page.title: 02HISTORY OF OLDBURY
page.content: The Romans settled in Oldbury on Severn about 2000 years ago. There are still remains of a Roman Fort. We can still see parts of the ditch and defence wall that used to surround the camp. At the back of our school, the Romans built a small hill which was used as a place of worship to Jupiter. This was also a look-out point, as there is a very good view of the surrounding countryside. Oldbury was an active port until this century. Brick and tiles were brought from Whale Wharf near Littleton on Severn a small village on the Severn, to Oldbury where they were ferried across the Severn to Wales. They brought back coal in exchange for the bricks and tiles. 100 years ago there was a working clay pit in Oldbury.
